definitions.definition: a spirit who is believed to be a servant of God, and is sent by God to deliver a message or perform a task. Angels are often shown dressed in white, with wings.

examples.text: a singer who has the voice of an angel
She wore a white costume with big furry angel wings.
a book about anti-heroes and fallen angels
He liked to think of himself as an avenging angel fighting for justice.
We lay back in the snow and made snow angels (= a shape made by moving your arms and legs back and forward while lying in snow).

definitions.definition: a person who is very good and kind; a child who behaves well

examples.text: John **is no angel**, believe me *(= he does not behave well)*.
I could hardly see Lisa in the role of ministering angel.

definitions.definition: used when you are talking to somebody and you are grateful to them

examples.text: **Be an angel** and make me a cup of coffee.

definitions.definition: a person who supports a business by investing money in it, especially somebody who supports a new small business with their own money

examples.text: When will the angels get their money back?
They started the business with the help of $2 million supplied by angel investors.

definitions.definition: people with little experience try to do the difficult or dangerous things that more experienced people would not consider doing

wordOrigin: Old English engel, ultimately via ecclesiastical Latin from Greek angelos ‘messenger’; superseded in Middle English by forms from Old French angele.
